author: Mark Hester

text: I dare to say Snakeman's theme is the most memorable of Megaman 3. Why you ask? Well, when I was a kid my older brother rented Megaman 3 and we used to play it (he more than me). Keep in mind this was around 1994/1997. Now, I downloaded the Disco Dan remix on ocremix (around 2007/2008) and as soon the 0:44 mark hitted, my brother recognized the song immediately, and he doesn't even care that much about videogame music. I dont know, I just feel both Megaman's version and the remix are insanely great and perhaps it tops half of Megaman 2 soundtrack

author: Levi Hackerman

text: Please tell me this is your ranking order for theme songs on the game... :-/
author: Leroy Stokes

text: @Leroy Stokes Haha yeah. It's not a boss order or something.
author: Levi Hackerman

text:
Oh gosh. As for my order in facing the bosses, five of them are connected in one group using some legitimate scientific logic (at least for the first three that I face), and the other three are connected in another group. The order I usually play the game is:

Group one--
1. Spark Man (I just use the standard arm cannon to beat him)
2. Magnet Man (scientific logic: Spark Man's Spark Shock negates the magnetism of Magnet Man)
3. Hard Man (scientific logic: Hard Man's body is made of a material that is highly magnetic, thus drawing the magnets to him)
4. Top Man (Hard Man's Hard Knuckle knocks Top Man off his spin)
5. Shadow Man (no real logic here)

Group two--
6. Snake Man (I just use the standard arm cannon to beat him)
7. Gemini Man (Search Snakes defeat him; don't understand the logic in the case of Gemini Man; it would have made more sense if the Gemini Twins weren't actually independent entities of one another and instead one being an illusion; it would then make sense that the Search Snake "seeks" out the real Gemini Man; my opinion, but I digress)
8. Needle Man (Gemini Laser defeats him; the fact that it bounces around the room a few times counters his high jumps and speed)
author: Leroy Stokes

text:
@Leroy Stokes Yeah pretty much. I've never understand why top spin would be a weakness for shadow man.

Needles were also snake man's weakness, just because maybe snakes don't like to slide on them ? haha.

author: Organic Rebounds Â§©

text:
LOL! You dont understand what he means.
4 Channels, 3 Oscillator Waveforms + 1 WAV PCM Voice, 
Compared with today:
32 Channels, Memory dependet PCM WAV Voices (256mb), Free modulateable Oscillator Waveforms.
Gosh.... in AAA Games like we have today are compressed Audofiles used like MP3. The Background noises comes from the compression which is not present in compiled oscillator music (COM = Chiptune).

author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon¬†lol, thanks a lot! XD
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: Your welcome.
author: FeiraDragon

text:
@*****¬†
1.It's pretty cool, we get to have our own levels and we can even get our own weapons! Only problem is, there is only a set of 8 weapons to choose and you have to be lucky to get a good one :P

2. We can do whatever we want, but I choose to play video games and have a Youtube account! ^-^
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†I'm surprised you didn't say anything about Toad Man.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon¬†So you guys still believe in that Megaman and Bass CD Database bullcrap?
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†Uh, sorry? I'm a fairly new fan of Megaman so I haven't quite figured out the personalities of most robot masters.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon So you don't what the CD database is? Let me explain: in Megaman and Bass, there were 100 CDs spread across the RM stages, each containing information about Classic Megaman characters. Here's the thing, though, they are 100% BS! In my CD, they said I liked Toad Man. LIES! I don't like Toad Man, he's freaking pathetic!
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†Most of what I know about Megaman is from let's plays. I'm a serious noob at 2d platformers. So out of the few Megaman games I've actually played, Powered Up is the only one I've gotten halfway through let alone completed and only on easy mode.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon I see, they're pretty hard for newcomers. If you want my tip, go play Megaman 2 in Normal mode, it's pretty easy and gets you prepared for the real thing. Others that I find pretty easy are MM6 and MM8.
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†Thanks for the advice. I'm stuck with emulators though so that probably has an effect on gameplay. I'm almost certain I'd do better with MM8 using an actual controller than I have with the keyboard.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon I'm OK with using keyboards to play Megaman, but if you're bothered with it, you can use XBox360 or PS3 controllers in your PC and there are even other USB controllers out there too.
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†That's good to know, thanks.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon You're welcome! Hope to see you around when you play Megaman 3! XD
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†Wanna know something ironic? A few hours after I told you I was a noob at Megaman, I managed to defeat 2 mavericks in Maverick Hunter X. I must've jinxed myself for the better.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @FeiraDragon¬†Good for you. I think X1 is one of the easiest MM games out there, so good luck!
author: Snake Man DWN-022

text: @Snake Man DWN-022¬†Thanks.
author: FeiraDragon

text: @Snake Man DWN-022 Your theme sounds like an anime opening but 8bit o
